00054 
00055 /** Utility routine used in code that prints out declarations; returns true
00056     if the given name should be printed, false otherwise.  This allows us
00057     to omit the names for various internal things (whose names start with
00058     double underscores) and emit anonymous declarations for them instead.
00059  */
00060 
00061 static bool
00062 lShouldPrintName(const std::string &name) {
00063     if (name.size() == 0)
00064         return false;
00065     else if (name[0] != '_')
00066         return true;
00067     else
00068         return (name.size() == 1) || (name[1] != '_');
00069 }

00075 const AtomicType *AtomicType::UniformBool = new AtomicType(TYPE_BOOL, true, false);

00077 const AtomicType *AtomicType::UniformInt32 = new AtomicType(TYPE_INT32, true, false);
00078 const AtomicType *AtomicType::VaryingInt32 = new AtomicType(TYPE_INT32, false, false);
00079 const AtomicType *AtomicType::UniformUInt32 = new AtomicType(TYPE_UINT32, true, false);
00080 const AtomicType *AtomicType::VaryingUInt32 = new AtomicType(TYPE_UINT32, false, false);
00081 const AtomicType *AtomicType::UniformFloat = new AtomicType(TYPE_FLOAT, true, false);
00082 const AtomicType *AtomicType::VaryingFloat = new AtomicType(TYPE_FLOAT, false, false);
00083 const AtomicType *AtomicType::UniformInt64 = new AtomicType(TYPE_INT64, true, false);
00084 const AtomicType *AtomicType::VaryingInt64 = new AtomicType(TYPE_INT64, false, false);
00085 const AtomicType *AtomicType::UniformUInt64 = new AtomicType(TYPE_UINT64, true, false);
00086 const AtomicType *AtomicType::VaryingUInt64 = new AtomicType(TYPE_UINT64, false, false);
00087 const AtomicType *AtomicType::UniformDouble = new AtomicType(TYPE_DOUBLE, true, false);
00088 const AtomicType *AtomicType::VaryingDouble = new AtomicType(TYPE_DOUBLE, false, false);
00089

00091 const AtomicType *AtomicType::VaryingConstBool = new AtomicType(TYPE_BOOL, false, true);
00092 const AtomicType *AtomicType::UniformConstInt32 = new AtomicType(TYPE_INT32, true, true);
00093 const AtomicType *AtomicType::VaryingConstInt32 = new AtomicType(TYPE_INT32, false, true);

00148 
00149 const AtomicType *
00150 AtomicType::GetAsUnsignedType() const {
00151     if (IsUnsignedType()) 
00152         return this;
00153 
00154     if (this == AtomicType::UniformInt32)           return AtomicType::UniformUInt32;
00155     else if (this == AtomicType::VaryingInt32)      return AtomicType::VaryingUInt32;
00156     else if (this == AtomicType::UniformInt64)      return AtomicType::UniformUInt64;
00157     else if (this == AtomicType::VaryingInt64)      return AtomicType::VaryingUInt64;
00158     else if (this == AtomicType::UniformConstInt32) return AtomicType::UniformConstUInt32;
00159     else if (this == AtomicType::VaryingConstInt32) return AtomicType::VaryingConstUInt32;
00160     else if (this == AtomicType::UniformConstInt64) return AtomicType::UniformConstUInt64;
00161     else if (this == AtomicType::VaryingConstInt64) return AtomicType::VaryingConstUInt64;
00162     else                                            return NULL;
00163 }
00164 
00165 
00166 const AtomicType *
00167 AtomicType::GetAsConstType() const {
00168     if (this == AtomicType::Void) 
00169         return this;
00170 
00171     switch (basicType) {
00172     case TYPE_BOOL:    return isUniform ? UniformConstBool   : VaryingConstBool;
00173     case TYPE_INT32:   return isUniform ? UniformConstInt32  : VaryingConstInt32;
00174     case TYPE_UINT32:  return isUniform ? UniformConstUInt32 : VaryingConstUInt32;
00175     case TYPE_FLOAT:   return isUniform ? UniformConstFloat  : VaryingConstFloat;
00176     case TYPE_INT64:   return isUniform ? UniformConstInt64  : VaryingConstInt64;
00177     case TYPE_UINT64:  return isUniform ? UniformConstUInt64 : VaryingConstUInt64;
00178     case TYPE_DOUBLE:  return isUniform ? UniformConstDouble : VaryingConstDouble;
00179     default:
00180         FATAL("logic error in AtomicType::GetAsConstType()");
00181         return NULL;
00182     }
00183 }
00184 
00185 
00186 const AtomicType *
00187 AtomicType::GetAsNonConstType() const {
00188     if (this == AtomicType::Void) 
00189         return this;
00190 
00191     switch (basicType) {
00192     case TYPE_BOOL:    return isUniform ? UniformBool   : VaryingBool;
00193     case TYPE_INT32:   return isUniform ? UniformInt32  : VaryingInt32;
00194     case TYPE_UINT32:  return isUniform ? UniformUInt32 : VaryingUInt32;
00195     case TYPE_FLOAT:   return isUniform ? UniformFloat  : VaryingFloat;
00196     case TYPE_INT64:   return isUniform ? UniformInt64  : VaryingInt64;
00197     case TYPE_UINT64:  return isUniform ? UniformUInt64 : VaryingUInt64;
00198     case TYPE_DOUBLE:  return isUniform ? UniformDouble : VaryingDouble;
00199     default:
00200         FATAL("logic error in AtomicType::GetAsNonConstType()");
00201         return NULL;
00202     }
00203 }

00211 
00212 const AtomicType *
00213 AtomicType::GetAsVaryingType() const {
00214     if (IsVaryingType()) 
00215         return this;
00216 
00217     switch (basicType) {
00218     case TYPE_VOID:   return this;
00219     case TYPE_BOOL:   return isConst ? AtomicType::VaryingConstBool   : AtomicType::VaryingBool;
00220     case TYPE_INT32:  return isConst ? AtomicType::VaryingConstInt32  : AtomicType::VaryingInt32;
00221     case TYPE_UINT32: return isConst ? AtomicType::VaryingConstUInt32 : AtomicType::VaryingUInt32;
00222     case TYPE_FLOAT:  return isConst ? AtomicType::VaryingConstFloat  : AtomicType::VaryingFloat;
00223     case TYPE_INT64:  return isConst ? AtomicType::VaryingConstInt64  : AtomicType::VaryingInt64;
00224     case TYPE_UINT64: return isConst ? AtomicType::VaryingConstUInt64 : AtomicType::VaryingUInt64;
00225     case TYPE_DOUBLE: return isConst ? AtomicType::VaryingConstDouble : AtomicType::VaryingDouble;
00226     default:          FATAL("Logic error in AtomicType::GetAsVaryingType()");
00227     }
00228     return NULL;
00229 }
00230 
00231 
00232 const AtomicType *
00233 AtomicType::GetAsUniformType() const {
00234     if (IsUniformType()) 
00235         return this;
00236 
00237     switch (basicType) {
00238     case TYPE_VOID:   return this;
00239     case TYPE_BOOL:   return isConst ? AtomicType::UniformConstBool : AtomicType::UniformBool;
00240     case TYPE_INT32:  return isConst ? AtomicType::UniformConstInt32 : AtomicType::UniformInt32;
00241     case TYPE_UINT32: return isConst ? AtomicType::UniformConstUInt32 : AtomicType::UniformUInt32;
00242     case TYPE_FLOAT:  return isConst ? AtomicType::UniformConstFloat : AtomicType::UniformFloat;
00243     case TYPE_INT64:  return isConst ? AtomicType::UniformConstInt64 : AtomicType::UniformInt64;
00244     case TYPE_UINT64: return isConst ? AtomicType::UniformConstUInt64 : AtomicType::UniformUInt64;
00245     case TYPE_DOUBLE: return isConst ? AtomicType::UniformConstDouble : AtomicType::UniformDouble;
00246     default:          FATAL("Logic error in AtomicType::GetAsUniformType()");
00247     }
00248     return NULL;
00249 }

00253 AtomicType::GetSOAType(int width) const {
00254     assert(width > 0);

00258 
00259 std::string
00260 AtomicType::GetString() const {
00261     std::string ret;
00262     if (basicType != TYPE_VOID) {
00263         if (isConst)   ret += "const ";
00264         if (isUniform) ret += "uniform ";
00265     }
00266 
00267     switch (basicType) {
00268     case TYPE_VOID:   ret += "void";            break;
00269     case TYPE_BOOL:   ret += "bool";            break;
00270     case TYPE_INT32:  ret += "int32";           break;
00271     case TYPE_UINT32: ret += "unsigned int32";  break;
00272     case TYPE_FLOAT:  ret += "float";           break;
00273     case TYPE_INT64:  ret += "int64";           break;
00274     case TYPE_UINT64: ret += "unsigned int64";  break;
00275     case TYPE_DOUBLE: ret += "double";          break;
00276     default: FATAL("Logic error in AtomicType::GetString()");
00277     }
00278     return ret;
00279 }
00280 
00281 
00282 std::string
00283 AtomicType::Mangle() const {
00284     std::string ret;
00285     if (isConst)   ret += "C";
00286     if (isUniform) ret += "U";
00287 
00288     switch (basicType) {
00289     case TYPE_VOID:   ret += "v"; break;
00290     case TYPE_BOOL:   ret += "b"; break;
00291     case TYPE_INT32:  ret += "i"; break;
00292     case TYPE_UINT32: ret += "u"; break;
00293     case TYPE_FLOAT:  ret += "f"; break;
00294     case TYPE_INT64:  ret += "I"; break;
00295     case TYPE_UINT64: ret += "U"; break;
00296     case TYPE_DOUBLE: ret += "d"; break;
00297     default: FATAL("Logic error in AtomicType::Mangle()");
00298     }
00299     return ret;
00300 }
00301 
00302 
00303 std::string
00304 AtomicType::GetCDeclaration(const std::string &name) const {
00305     std::string ret;
00306     assert(isUniform);
00307     if (isConst) ret += "const ";
00308 
00309     switch (basicType) {
00310     case TYPE_VOID:   ret += "void";     break;
00311     case TYPE_BOOL:   ret += "bool";     break;
00312     case TYPE_INT32:  ret += "int32_t";  break;
00313     case TYPE_UINT32: ret += "uint32_t"; break;
00314     case TYPE_FLOAT:  ret += "float";    break;
00315     case TYPE_DOUBLE: ret += "double";   break;
00316     case TYPE_INT64:  ret += "int64_t";  break;
00317     case TYPE_UINT64: ret += "uint64_t"; break;
00318     default: FATAL("Logic error in AtomicType::GetCDeclaration()");
00319     }
00320 
00321     if (lShouldPrintName(name)) {
00322         ret += " ";
00323         ret += name;
00324     }
00325     return ret;
00326 }
00327 
00328 
00329 const llvm::Type *
00330 AtomicType::LLVMType(llvm::LLVMContext *ctx) const {
00331     switch (basicType) {
00332     case TYPE_VOID:
00333         return llvm::Type::getVoidTy(*ctx);
00334     case TYPE_BOOL:
00335         return isUniform ? LLVMTypes::BoolType : LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType;
00336     case TYPE_INT32:
00337     case TYPE_UINT32:
00338         return isUniform ? LLVMTypes::Int32Type : LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType;
00339     case TYPE_FLOAT:
00340         return isUniform ? LLVMTypes::FloatType : LLVMTypes::FloatVectorType;
00341     case TYPE_INT64:
00342     case TYPE_UINT64:
00343         return isUniform ? LLVMTypes::Int64Type : LLVMTypes::Int64VectorType;
00344     case TYPE_DOUBLE:
00345         return isUniform ? LLVMTypes::DoubleType : LLVMTypes::DoubleVectorType;
00346     default:
00347         FATAL("logic error in AtomicType::LLVMType");
00348         return NULL;
00349     }
00350 }
00351 
00352 
00353 llvm::DIType
00354 AtomicType::GetDIType(llvm::DIDescriptor scope) const {
00355 #ifdef LLVM_2_8
00356     FATAL("debug info not supported in llvm 2.8");
00357     return llvm::DIType();
00358 #else
00359     if (isUniform) {
00360         switch (basicType) {
00361         case TYPE_VOID:
00362             return llvm::DIType();
00363         case TYPE_BOOL:
00364             return m->diBuilder->createBasicType("bool", 32 /* size */, 32 /* align */,
00365                                                  llvm::dwarf::DW_ATE_unsigned);
00366             break;
00367         case TYPE_INT32:
00368             return m->diBuilder->createBasicType("int32", 32 /* size */, 32 /* align */,
00369                                                  llvm::dwarf::DW_ATE_signed);
00370             break;
00371         case TYPE_UINT32:
00372             return m->diBuilder->createBasicType("uint32", 32 /* size */, 32 /* align */,
00373                                                  llvm::dwarf::DW_ATE_unsigned);
00374             break;
00375         case TYPE_FLOAT:
00376             return m->diBuilder->createBasicType("float", 32 /* size */, 32 /* align */,
00377                                                  llvm::dwarf::DW_ATE_float);
00378             break;
00379         case TYPE_DOUBLE:
00380             return m->diBuilder->createBasicType("double", 64 /* size */, 64 /* align */,
00381                                                  llvm::dwarf::DW_ATE_float);
00382             break;
00383         case TYPE_INT64:
00384             return m->diBuilder->createBasicType("int64", 64 /* size */, 64 /* align */,
00385                                                  llvm::dwarf::DW_ATE_signed);
00386             break;
00387         case TYPE_UINT64:
00388             return m->diBuilder->createBasicType("uint64", 64 /* size */, 64 /* align */,
00389                                                  llvm::dwarf::DW_ATE_unsigned);
00390             break;
00391         default:
00392             FATAL("unhandled basic type in AtomicType::GetDIType()");
00393             return llvm::DIType();
00394         }
00395     }
00396     else {
00397         llvm::DIType unifType = GetAsUniformType()->GetDIType(scope);
00398         llvm::Value *sub = m->diBuilder->getOrCreateSubrange(0, g->target.vectorWidth-1);
00399 #ifdef LLVM_2_9
00400         llvm::Value *suba[] = { sub };
00401         llvm::DIArray subArray = m->diBuilder->getOrCreateArray(suba, 1);
00402 #else
00403         llvm::DIArray subArray = m->diBuilder->getOrCreateArray(sub);
00404 #endif // LLVM_2_9
00405         uint64_t size =  unifType.getSizeInBits()  * g->target.vectorWidth;
00406         uint64_t align = unifType.getAlignInBits() * g->target.vectorWidth;
00407         return m->diBuilder->createVectorType(size, align, unifType, subArray);
00408     }
00409 #endif // LLVM_2_8
00410 }

00424 ArrayType::ArrayType(const Type *c, int a) 
00425     : child(c), numElements(a) {
00426     // 0 -> unsized array.
00427     assert(numElements >= 0);
00428 }
00429 
00430 
00431 const llvm::ArrayType *
00432 ArrayType::LLVMType(llvm::LLVMContext *ctx) const {
00433     if (!child)
00434         return NULL;
00435 
00436     const llvm::Type *ct = child->LLVMType(ctx);
00437     if (!ct)
00438         return NULL;
00439     return llvm::ArrayType::get(ct, numElements);
00440 }

00478 
00479 const Type *
00480 ArrayType::GetBaseType() const {
00481     const Type *type = child;
00482     const ArrayType *at = dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(type);
00483     // Keep walking until we reach a child that isn't itself an array
00484     while (at) {
00485         type = at->child;
00486         at = dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(type);
00487     }
00488     return type;
00489 }
00490

00533 
00534 std::string
00535 ArrayType::GetString() const {
00536     std::string s = GetBaseType()->GetString();
00537 
00538     const ArrayType *at = this;
00539     // Walk through this and any children arrays and print all of their
00540     // dimensions
00541     while (at) {
00542         char buf[16];
00543         if (numElements > 0)
00544             sprintf(buf, "%d", at->numElements);
00545         else
00546             buf[0] = '\0';
00547         s += std::string("[") + std::string(buf) + std::string("]");
00548         at = dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(at->child);
00549     }
00550     return s;
00551 }
00552 
00553 
00554 std::string
00555 ArrayType::Mangle() const {
00556     std::string s = child->Mangle();
00557     char buf[16];
00558     if (numElements > 0)
00559         sprintf(buf, "%d", numElements);
00560     else
00561         buf[0] = '\0';
00562     return s + "[" + buf + "]";
00563 }
00564 
00565 
00566 std::string
00567 ArrayType::GetCDeclaration(const std::string &name) const {
00568     std::string s = GetBaseType()->GetCDeclaration(name);
00569 
00570     const ArrayType *at = this;
00571     while (at) {
00572         char buf[16];
00573         if (numElements > 0)
00574             sprintf(buf, "%d", at->numElements);
00575         else
00576             buf[0] = '\0';
00577         s += std::string("[") + std::string(buf) + std::string("]");
00578         at = dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(at->child);
00579     }
00580     return s;
00581 }
00582 
00583 
00584 int
00585 ArrayType::TotalElementCount() const {
00586     const ArrayType *ct = dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(child);
00587     if (ct)
00588         return numElements * ct->TotalElementCount();
00589     else
00590         return numElements;
00591 }
00592 
00593 
00594 llvm::DIType
00595 ArrayType::GetDIType(llvm::DIDescriptor scope) const {
00596 #ifdef LLVM_2_8
00597     FATAL("debug info not supported in llvm 2.8");
00598     return llvm::DIType();
00599 #else
00600     if (!child)
00601         return llvm::DIType();
00602 
00603     llvm::DIType eltType = child->GetDIType(scope);
00604 
00605     int lowerBound = 0, upperBound = numElements-1;
00606     if (numElements == 0) {
00607         // unsized array -> indicate with low > high
00608         lowerBound = 1;
00609         upperBound = 0;
00610     }
00611 
00612     llvm::Value *sub = m->diBuilder->getOrCreateSubrange(lowerBound, upperBound);
00613     std::vector<llvm::Value *> subs;
00614     subs.push_back(sub);
00615 #ifdef LLVM_2_9
00616     llvm::DIArray subArray = m->diBuilder->getOrCreateArray(&subs[0], subs.size());
00617 #else
00618     llvm::DIArray subArray = m->diBuilder->getOrCreateArray(subs);
00619 #endif
00620 
00621     // it's intentional that size is zero for unsized arrays
00622     uint64_t size = eltType.getSizeInBits() * numElements;
00623     uint64_t align = eltType.getAlignInBits();
00624 
00625     return m->diBuilder->createArrayType(size, align, eltType, subArray);
00626 #endif // LLVM_2_8
00627 }
00628 
00629 
00630 ArrayType *
00631 ArrayType::GetSizedArray(int sz) const {
00632     assert(numElements == 0);
00633     return new ArrayType(child, sz);
00634 }
00635

00637 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00638 // SOAArrayType
00639 
00640 SOAArrayType::SOAArrayType(const StructType *eltType, int nElem, int sw) 
00641     : ArrayType(eltType, nElem), soaWidth(sw) {
00642     assert(soaWidth > 0);
00643     if (numElements > 0)
00644         assert((numElements % soaWidth) == 0);
00645 }

00651 SOAArrayType::GetAsVaryingType() const {

00653                             numElements, soaWidth);

00679 SOAArrayType::GetAsNonConstType() const {
00680     return new SOAArrayType(dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(child->GetAsNonConstType()), 
00681                             numElements, soaWidth);
00682 }
00683 
00684 
00685 std::string
00686 SOAArrayType::GetString() const {
00687     std::string s;
00688 
00689     char buf[32];
00690     sprintf(buf, "soa<%d> ", soaWidth);
00691     s += buf;
00692     s += GetBaseType()->GetString();
00693 
00694     const ArrayType *at = this;
00695     while (at) {
00696         char buf[16];
00697         if (numElements > 0)
00698             sprintf(buf, "%d", at->numElements);
00699         else
00700             buf[0] = '\0';
00701         s += std::string("[") + std::string(buf) + std::string("]");
00702         at = dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(at->child);
00703     }
00704     return s;
00705 }
00706 
00707 
00708 std::string
00709 SOAArrayType::Mangle() const {
00710     const Type *t = soaType();
00711     return t->Mangle();
00712 }
00713 
00714 
00715 std::string
00716 SOAArrayType::GetCDeclaration(const std::string &name) const {
00717     const Type *t = soaType();
00718     return t->GetCDeclaration(name);
00719 }
00720 
00721 
00722 int
00723 SOAArrayType::TotalElementCount() const {
00724     int sz = numElements / soaWidth;
00725     const ArrayType *ct = dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(child);
00726     if (ct)
00727         return sz * ct->TotalElementCount();
00728     else
00729         return sz;
00730 }
00731 
00732 
00733 const llvm::ArrayType *
00734 SOAArrayType::LLVMType(llvm::LLVMContext *ctx) const {
00735     if (!child)
00736         return NULL;
00737 
00738     const ArrayType *a = soaType();
00739     if (!a)
00740         return NULL;
00741     return a->LLVMType(ctx);
00742 }
00743 
00744 
00745 llvm::DIType
00746 SOAArrayType::GetDIType(llvm::DIDescriptor scope) const {
00747 #ifdef LLVM_2_8
00748     FATAL("debug info not supported in llvm 2.8");
00749     return llvm::DIType();
00750 #else
00751     if (!child)
00752         return llvm::DIType();
00753 
00754     const Type *t = soaType();
00755     return t->GetDIType(scope);
00756 #endif
00757 }

00759 
00760 SOAArrayType *
00761 SOAArrayType::GetSizedArray(int size) const {
00762     if ((size % soaWidth) != 0)
00763         return NULL;
00764     return new SOAArrayType(dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(child), size, soaWidth);
00765 }
00766 
00767 
00768 const ArrayType *
00769 SOAArrayType::soaType() const {
00770     const Type *childSOA = child->GetSOAType(soaWidth);
00771     return new ArrayType(childSOA, numElements / soaWidth);
00772 }

00895 
00896 
00897 const llvm::Type *
00898 VectorType::LLVMType(llvm::LLVMContext *ctx) const {
00899     const llvm::Type *bt = base->LLVMType(ctx);
00900     if (!bt)
00901         return NULL;
00902 
00903     if (base->IsUniformType())
00904         // vectors of uniform types are laid out across LLVM vectors, with
00905         // the llvm vector size set to be a multiple of the machine's
00906         // natural vector size (e.g. 4 on SSE).  This is a roundabout way
00907         // of ensuring that LLVM lays them out into machine vector
00908         // registers so that e.g. if we want to add two uniform 4 float
00909         // vectors, that is turned into a single addps on SSE.
00910         return llvm::VectorType::get(bt, getVectorMemoryCount());
00911     else
00912         // varying types are already laid out to fill HW vector registers,
00913         // so a vector type here is just expanded out as an llvm array.
00914         return llvm::ArrayType::get(bt, getVectorMemoryCount());
00915 }
00916 
00917 
00918 llvm::DIType
00919 VectorType::GetDIType(llvm::DIDescriptor scope) const {
00920 #ifdef LLVM_2_8
00921     FATAL("debug info not supported in llvm 2.8");
00922     return llvm::DIType();
00923 #else
00924     llvm::DIType eltType = base->GetDIType(scope);
00925     llvm::Value *sub = m->diBuilder->getOrCreateSubrange(0, numElements-1);
00926 #ifdef LLVM_2_9
00927     llvm::Value *subs[1] = { sub };
00928     llvm::DIArray subArray = m->diBuilder->getOrCreateArray(subs, 1);
00929 #else
00930     llvm::DIArray subArray = m->diBuilder->getOrCreateArray(sub);
00931 #endif
00932 
00933     uint64_t sizeBits = eltType.getSizeInBits() * numElements;
00934 
00935     // vectors of varying types are already naturally aligned to the
00936     // machine's vector width, but arrays of uniform types need to be
00937     // explicitly aligned to the machines natural vector alignment.
00938     uint64_t align = eltType.getAlignInBits();
00939     if (IsUniformType())
00940         align = 4 * g->target.nativeVectorWidth;
00941 
00942     return m->diBuilder->createVectorType(sizeBits, align, eltType, subArray);
00943 #endif // LLVM_2_8
00944 }
00945 
00946 
00947 int
00948 VectorType::getVectorMemoryCount() const {
00949     if (base->IsVaryingType())
00950         return numElements;
00951     else {
00952         int nativeWidth = g->target.nativeVectorWidth;
00953         if (base->GetAsUniformType() == AtomicType::UniformInt64 ||
00954             base->GetAsUniformType() == AtomicType::UniformUInt64 ||
00955             base->GetAsUniformType() == AtomicType::UniformDouble)
00956             // target.nativeVectorWidth should be in terms of 32-bit
00957             // values, so for the 64-bit guys, it takes half as many of
00958             // them to fill the native width
00959             nativeWidth /= 2;
00960         // and now round up the element count to be a multiple of
00961         // nativeWidth
00962         return (numElements + (nativeWidth - 1)) & ~(nativeWidth-1);
00963     }
00964 }

01039 
01040 
01041 const Type *
01042 StructType::GetSOAType(int width) const {
01043     std::vector<const Type *> et;
01044     // The SOA version of a structure is just a structure that holds SOAed
01045     // versions of its elements
01046     for (int i = 0; i < GetElementCount(); ++i) {
01047         const Type *t = GetElementType(i);
01048         et.push_back(t->GetSOAType(width));
01049     }
01050     return new StructType(name, et, elementNames, elementPositions,
01051                           isConst, isUniform, pos);
01052 }
01053 
01054 
01055 const StructType *
01056 StructType::GetAsConstType() const {
01057     if (IsConstType()) 
01058         return this;
01059     else
01060         return new StructType(name, elementTypes, elementNames, 
01061                               elementPositions, true, isUniform, pos);
01062 }
01063 
01064 
01065 const StructType *
01066 StructType::GetAsNonConstType() const {
01067     if (!IsConstType()) 
01068         return this;
01069     else
01070         return new StructType(name, elementTypes, elementNames, elementPositions,
01071                               false, isUniform, pos);
01072 }
01073 
01074 
01075 std::string
01076 StructType::GetString() const {
01077     std::string ret;
01078     if (isConst)   ret += "const ";
01079     if (isUniform) ret += "uniform ";
01080     else           ret += "varying ";
01081 
01082     // Don't print the entire struct declaration, just print the struct's name.
01083     // @todo Do we need a separate method that prints the declaration?
01084 #if 0
01085     ret += std::string("struct { ") + name;
01086     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < elementTypes.size(); ++i) {
01087         ret += elementTypes[i]->GetString();
01088         ret += " ";
01089         ret += elementNames[i];
01090         ret += "; ";
01091     }
01092     ret += "}";
01093 #else
01094     ret += "struct ";
01095     ret += name;
01096 #endif
01097     return ret;
01098 }
01099 
01100 
01101 std::string
01102 StructType::Mangle() const {
01103     std::string ret;
01104     ret += "s[";
01105     if (isConst)
01106         ret += "_c_";
01107     if (isUniform)
01108         ret += "_u_";
01109     ret += name + std::string("]<");
01110     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < elementTypes.size(); ++i)
01111         ret += elementTypes[i]->Mangle();
01112     ret += ">";
01113     return ret;
01114 }
01115     
01116 
01117 std::string
01118 StructType::GetCDeclaration(const std::string &n) const {
01119     std::string ret;
01120     if (isConst) ret += "const ";
01121     ret += std::string("struct ") + name;
01122     if (lShouldPrintName(n))
01123         ret += std::string(" ") + n;
01124     if (!isUniform) {
01125         char buf[16];
01126         sprintf(buf, "[%d]", g->target.vectorWidth);
01127         ret += buf;
01128     }
01129     return ret;
01130 }
01131 
01132 
01133 const llvm::Type *
01134 StructType::LLVMType(llvm::LLVMContext *ctx) const {
01135     std::vector<const llvm::Type *> llvmTypes;
01136     for (int i = 0; i < GetElementCount(); ++i) {
01137         const Type *type = GetElementType(i);
01138         llvmTypes.push_back(type->LLVMType(ctx));
01139     }
01140     return llvm::StructType::get(*ctx, llvmTypes);
01141 }
01142 
01143 
01144 llvm::DIType
01145 StructType::GetDIType(llvm::DIDescriptor scope) const {
01146 #ifdef LLVM_2_8
01147     FATAL("debug info not supported in llvm 2.8");
01148     return llvm::DIType();
01149 #else
01150     uint64_t currentSize = 0, align = 0;
01151 
01152     std::vector<llvm::Value *> elementLLVMTypes;
01153     // Walk through the elements of the struct; for each one figure out its
01154     // alignment and size, using that to figure out its offset w.r.t. the
01155     // start of the structure.
01156     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < elementTypes.size(); ++i) {
01157         llvm::DIType eltType = GetElementType(i)->GetDIType(scope);
01158         uint64_t eltAlign = eltType.getAlignInBits();
01159         uint64_t eltSize = eltType.getSizeInBits();
01160 
01161         // The alignment for the entire structure is the maximum of the
01162         // required alignments of its elements
01163         align = std::max(align, eltAlign);
01164 
01165         // Move the current size forward if needed so that the current
01166         // element starts at an offset that's the correct alignment.
01167         if (currentSize > 0 && (currentSize % eltAlign))
01168             currentSize += eltAlign - (currentSize % eltAlign);
01169         assert((currentSize == 0) || (currentSize % eltAlign) == 0);
01170 
01171         llvm::DIFile diFile = elementPositions[i].GetDIFile();
01172         int line = elementPositions[i].first_line;
01173 #ifdef LLVM_2_9
01174         llvm::DIType fieldType = 
01175             m->diBuilder->createMemberType(elementNames[i], diFile, line,
01176                                            eltSize, eltAlign, currentSize, 0,
01177                                            eltType);
01178 #else
01179         llvm::DIType fieldType = 
01180             m->diBuilder->createMemberType(scope, elementNames[i], diFile, 
01181                                            line, eltSize, eltAlign, 
01182                                            currentSize, 0, eltType);
01183 #endif // LLVM_2_9
01184         elementLLVMTypes.push_back(fieldType);
01185 
01186         currentSize += eltSize;
01187     }
01188 
01189     // Round up the struct's entire size so that it's a multiple of the
01190     // required alignment that we figured out along the way...
01191     if (currentSize > 0 && (currentSize % align))
01192         currentSize += align - (currentSize % align);
01193 
01194 #ifdef LLVM_2_9
01195     llvm::DIArray elements = m->diBuilder->getOrCreateArray(&elementLLVMTypes[0], 
01196                                                             elementLLVMTypes.size());
01197 #else
01198     llvm::DIArray elements = m->diBuilder->getOrCreateArray(elementLLVMTypes);
01199 #endif
01200     llvm::DIFile diFile = pos.GetDIFile();
01201     return m->diBuilder->createStructType(scope, name, diFile, pos.first_line, currentSize, 
01202                                           align, 0, elements);
01203 #endif // LLVM_2_8
01204 }
01205 
01206 
01207 const Type *
01208 StructType::GetElementType(int i) const {
01209     assert(i < (int)elementTypes.size());
01210     // If the struct is uniform qualified, then each member comes out with
01211     // the same type as in the original source file.  If it's varying, then
01212     // all members are promoted to varying.
01213     const Type *ret = isUniform ? elementTypes[i] : 
01214         elementTypes[i]->GetAsVaryingType();
01215     return isConst ? ret->GetAsConstType() : ret;
01216 }
01217 
01218 
01219 const Type *
01220 StructType::GetElementType(const std::string &n) const {
01221     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < elementNames.size(); ++i)
01222         if (elementNames[i] == n) {
01223             const Type *ret = isUniform ? elementTypes[i] : 
01224                 elementTypes[i]->GetAsVaryingType();
01225             return isConst ? ret->GetAsConstType() : ret;
01226         }
01227     return NULL;
01228 }
01229 
01230 
01231 int
01232 StructType::GetElementNumber(const std::string &n) const {
01233     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < elementNames.size(); ++i)
01234         if (elementNames[i] == n)
01235             return i;
01236     return -1;
01237 }

01332 
01333 
01334 std::string
01335 ReferenceType::GetString() const {
01336     std::string ret;
01337     if (isConst || targetType->IsConstType())
01338         ret += "const ";
01339     ret += std::string("reference<") + targetType->GetAsNonConstType()->GetString() + 
01340         std::string(">");
01341     return ret;
01342 }
01343 
01344 
01345 std::string
01346 ReferenceType::Mangle() const {
01347     std::string ret;
01348     if (isConst)
01349         ret += "C";
01350     ret += std::string("REF") + targetType->Mangle();
01351     return ret;
01352 }
01353 
01354 
01355 std::string
01356 ReferenceType::GetCDeclaration(const std::string &name) const {
01357     const ArrayType *at = dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(targetType);
01358     if (at != NULL) {
01359         if (at->GetElementCount() == 0) {
01360             // emit unsized arrays as pointers to the base type..
01361             std::string ret;
01362             if (isConst || at->GetElementType()->IsConstType())
01363                 ret += "const ";
01364             ret += at->GetElementType()->GetAsNonConstType()->GetCDeclaration("") + 
01365                 std::string(" *");
01366             if (lShouldPrintName(name))
01367                 ret += name;
01368             return ret;
01369         }
01370         else
01371             // otherwise forget about the reference part if it's an
01372             // array since C already passes arrays by reference...
01373             return targetType->GetCDeclaration(name);
01374     }
01375     else {
01376         std::string ret;
01377         if (isConst || targetType->IsConstType())
01378             ret += "const ";
01379         ret += targetType->GetAsNonConstType()->GetCDeclaration("") + 
01380             std::string(" *");
01381         if (lShouldPrintName(name))
01382             ret += name;
01383         return ret;
01384     }
01385 }
01386 
01387 
01388 const llvm::Type *
01389 ReferenceType::LLVMType(llvm::LLVMContext *ctx) const {
01390     if (!targetType)
01391         return NULL;
01392     const llvm::Type *t = targetType->LLVMType(ctx);
01393     if (!t)
01394         return NULL;
01395     return llvm::PointerType::get(t, 0);
01396 }
01397 
01398 
01399 llvm::DIType
01400 ReferenceType::GetDIType(llvm::DIDescriptor scope) const {
01401 #ifdef LLVM_2_8
01402     FATAL("debug info not supported in llvm 2.8");
01403     return llvm::DIType();
01404 #else
01405     llvm::DIType diTargetType = targetType->GetDIType(scope);
01406     return m->diBuilder->createReferenceType(diTargetType);
01407 #endif // LLVM_2_8
01408 }

01499 
01500 std::string
01501 FunctionType::GetString() const {
01502     std::string ret;
01503     if (isTask) ret += "task ";
01504     ret += returnType->GetString();
01505     ret += "(";
01506     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < argTypes.size(); ++i) {
01507         ret += argTypes[i]->GetString();
01508         if (i != argTypes.size() - 1)
01509             ret += ", ";
01510     }
01511     ret += ")";
01512     return ret;
01513 }
01514 
01515 
01516 std::string
01517 FunctionType::Mangle() const {
01518     std::string ret = "___";
01519     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < argTypes.size(); ++i)
01520         ret += argTypes[i]->Mangle();
01521     return ret;
01522 }
01523 
01524 
01525 std::string
01526 FunctionType::GetCDeclaration(const std::string &fname) const {
01527     std::string ret;
01528     ret += returnType->GetCDeclaration("");
01529     ret += " ";
01530     ret += fname;
01531     ret += "(";
01532     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < argTypes.size(); ++i) {
01533         if (argNames.size())
01534             ret += argTypes[i]->GetCDeclaration(argNames[i]);
01535         else
01536             ret += argTypes[i]->GetString();
01537         if (i != argTypes.size() - 1)
01538             ret += ", ";
01539     }
01540     ret += ")";
01541     return ret;
01542 }

01558 
01559 
01560 const llvm::FunctionType *
01561 FunctionType::LLVMFunctionType(llvm::LLVMContext *ctx, bool includeMask) const {
01562     if (!includeMask && isTask) {
01563         Error(pos, "Function can't have both \"task\" and \"export\" qualifiers");
01564         return NULL;
01565     }
01566 
01567     // Get the LLVM Type *s for the function arguments
01568     std::vector<const llvm::Type *> llvmArgTypes;
01569     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < argTypes.size(); ++i) {
01570         if (!argTypes[i])
01571             return NULL;
01572 
01573         const llvm::Type *t = argTypes[i]->LLVMType(ctx);
01574         if (!t)
01575             return NULL;
01576         llvmArgTypes.push_back(t);
01577     }
01578 
01579     // And add the function mask, if asked for
01580     if (includeMask)
01581         llvmArgTypes.push_back(LLVMTypes::MaskType);
01582 
01583     std::vector<const llvm::Type *> callTypes;
01584     if (isTask) {
01585         // Tasks take three arguments: a pointer to a struct that holds the
01586         // actual task arguments, the thread index, and the total number of
01587         // threads the tasks system has running.  (Task arguments are
01588         // marshalled in a struct so that it's easy to allocate space to
01589         // hold them until the task actually runs.)
01590         llvm::Type *st = llvm::StructType::get(*ctx, llvmArgTypes);
01591         callTypes.push_back(llvm::PointerType::getUnqual(st));
01592         callTypes.push_back(LLVMTypes::Int32Type); // threadIndex
01593         callTypes.push_back(LLVMTypes::Int32Type); // threadCount
01594     }
01595     else
01596         // Otherwise we already have the types of the arguments 
01597         callTypes = llvmArgTypes;
01598 
01599     return llvm::FunctionType::get(returnType->LLVMType(g->ctx), callTypes, false);
01600 }
01601

01603 void
01604 FunctionType::SetArgumentDefaults(const std::vector<ConstExpr *> &d) const {
01605     assert(argDefaults.size() == 0);
01606     assert(d.size() == argTypes.size());
01607     argDefaults = d;
01608 }

01626 
01627 
01628 /** Given an atomic or vector type, return a vector type of the given
01629     vecSize.  Issue an error if given a vector type that isn't already that
01630     size.
01631  */
01632 static const Type *
01633 lVectorConvert(const Type *type, SourcePos pos, const char *reason, int vecSize) {
01634     const VectorType *vt = dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(type);
01635     if (vt) {
01636         if (vt->GetElementCount() != vecSize) {
01637             Error(pos, "Implicit conversion between from vector type "
01638                   "\"%s\" to vector type of length %d for %s is not possible.", 
01639                   type->GetString().c_str(), vecSize, reason);
01640             return NULL;
01641         }
01642         return vt;
01643     }
01644     else {
01645         const AtomicType *at = dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(type);
01646         if (!at) {
01647             Error(pos, "Non-atomic type \"%s\" can't be converted to vector type "
01648                   "for %s.", type->GetString().c_str(), reason);
01649             return NULL;
01650         }
01651         return new VectorType(at, vecSize);
01652     }
01653 }
01654 
01655 
01656 const Type *
01657 Type::MoreGeneralType(const Type *t0, const Type *t1, SourcePos pos, const char *reason, 
01658                       bool forceVarying, int vecSize) {
01659     assert(reason != NULL);
01660 
01661     // First, if we need to go varying, promote both of the types to be
01662     // varying.
01663     if (t0->IsVaryingType() || t1->IsVaryingType() || forceVarying) {
01664         t0 = t0->GetAsVaryingType();
01665         t1 = t1->GetAsVaryingType();
01666     }
01667 
01668     // And similarly, promote them both to vectors if the caller requested
01669     // a particular vector size
01670     if (vecSize > 0) {
01671         t0 = lVectorConvert(t0, pos, reason, vecSize);
01672         t1 = lVectorConvert(t1, pos, reason, vecSize);
01673         if (!t0 || !t1)
01674             return NULL;
01675     }
01676 
01677     // Are they both the same type?  If so, we're done, QED.
01678     if (Type::Equal(t0, t1)) 
01679         return t0;
01680 
01681     // Not the same types, but only a const/non-const difference?  Return
01682     // the non-const type as the more general one.
01683     if (Type::Equal(t0->GetAsConstType(), t1->GetAsConstType()))
01684         return t0->GetAsNonConstType();
01685 
01686     const VectorType *vt0 = dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(t0);
01687     const VectorType *vt1 = dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(t1);
01688     if (vt0 && vt1) {
01689         // both are vectors; convert their base types and make a new vector
01690         // type, as long as their lengths match
01691         if (vt0->GetElementCount() != vt1->GetElementCount()) {
01692             Error(pos, "Implicit conversion between differently sized vector types "
01693                   "(%s, %s) for %s is not possible.", t0->GetString().c_str(),
01694                   t1->GetString().c_str(), reason);
01695             return NULL;
01696         }
01697         const Type *t = MoreGeneralType(vt0->GetElementType(), vt1->GetElementType(),
01698                                         pos, reason, forceVarying);
01699         if (!t) 
01700             return NULL;
01701 
01702         // The 'more general' version of the two vector element types must
01703         // be an AtomicType (that's all that vectors can hold...)
01704         const AtomicType *at = dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(t);
01705         assert(at != NULL);
01706 
01707         return new VectorType(at, vt0->GetElementCount());
01708     }
01709     else if (vt0) {
01710         // If one type is a vector type but the other isn't, see if we can
01711         // promote the other one to a vector type.  This will fail and
01712         // return NULL if t1 is e.g. an array type and it's illegal to have
01713         // a vector of it..
01714         const Type *t = MoreGeneralType(vt0->GetElementType(), t1, pos, 
01715                                         reason, forceVarying);
01716         if (!t) 
01717             return NULL;
01718 
01719         const AtomicType *at = dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(t);
01720         assert(at != NULL);
01721         return new VectorType(at, vt0->GetElementCount());
01722     }
01723     else if (vt1) {
01724         // As in the above case, see if we can promote t0 to make a vector
01725         // that matches vt1.
01726         const Type *t = MoreGeneralType(t0, vt1->GetElementType(), pos, 
01727                                         reason, forceVarying);
01728         if (!t) 
01729             return NULL;
01730 
01731         const AtomicType *at = dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(t);
01732         assert(at != NULL);
01733         return new VectorType(at, vt1->GetElementCount());
01734     }
01735 
01736     // TODO: what do we need to do about references here, if anything??
01737 
01738     // Now all we can do is promote atomic types...
01739     const AtomicType *at0 = dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(t0->GetReferenceTarget());
01740     const AtomicType *at1 = dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(t1->GetReferenceTarget());
01741 
01742     if (!at0 || !at1) {
01743         assert(reason);
01744         Error(pos, "Implicit conversion from type \"%s\" to \"%s\" for %s not possible.",
01745               t0->GetString().c_str(), t1->GetString().c_str(), reason);
01746         return NULL;
01747     }
01748 
01749     // Finally, to determine which of the two atomic types is more general,
01750     // use the ordering of entries in the AtomicType::BasicType enumerant.
01751     return (int(at0->basicType) >= int(at1->basicType)) ? at0 : at1;
01752 }
01753 
01754 
01755 bool
01756 Type::Equal(const Type *a, const Type *b) {
01757     if (!a || !b)
01758         return false;
01759 
01760     // We can compare AtomicTypes with pointer equality, since the
01761     // AtomicType constructor is private so that there isonly the single
01762     // canonical instance of the AtomicTypes (AtomicType::UniformInt32,
01763     // etc.)
01764     if (dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(a) &&
01765         dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(b))
01766         return a == b;
01767 
01768     // For all of the other types, we need to see if we have the same two
01769     // general types.  If so, then we dig into the details of the type and
01770     // see if all of the relevant bits are equal...
01771     const ArrayType *ata = dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(a);
01772     const ArrayType *atb = dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(b);
01773     if (ata && atb)
01774         return (ata->GetElementCount() == atb->GetElementCount() && 
01775                 Equal(ata->GetElementType(), atb->GetElementType()));
01776 
01777     const VectorType *vta = dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(a);
01778     const VectorType *vtb = dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(b);
01779     if (vta && vtb)
01780         return (vta->GetElementCount() == vtb->GetElementCount() && 
01781                 Equal(vta->GetElementType(), vtb->GetElementType()));
01782 
01783     const StructType *sta = dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(a);
01784     const StructType *stb = dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(b);
01785     if (sta && stb) {
01786         if (sta->GetElementCount() != stb->GetElementCount())
01787             return false;
01788         for (int i = 0; i < sta->GetElementCount(); ++i)
01789             if (!Equal(sta->GetElementType(i), stb->GetElementType(i)))
01790                 return false;
01791         return true;
01792     }
01793 
01794     const ReferenceType *rta = dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(a);
01795     const ReferenceType *rtb = dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(b);
01796     if (rta && rtb)
01797         return Type::Equal(rta->GetReferenceTarget(),
01798                            rtb->GetReferenceTarget());
01799 
01800     const FunctionType *fta = dynamic_cast<const FunctionType *>(a);
01801     const FunctionType *ftb = dynamic_cast<const FunctionType *>(b);
01802     if (fta && ftb) {
01803         // Both the return types and all of the argument types must match
01804         // for function types to match
01805         if (!Equal(fta->GetReturnType(), ftb->GetReturnType()))
01806             return false;
01807 
01808         const std::vector<const Type *> &aargs = fta->GetArgumentTypes();
01809         const std::vector<const Type *> &bargs = ftb->GetArgumentTypes();
01810         if (aargs.size() != bargs.size())
01811             return false;
01812         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < aargs.size(); ++i)
01813             if (!Equal(aargs[i], bargs[i]))
01814                 return false;
01815         return true;
01816     }
01817 
01818     return false;
01819 }
